intro: Hieracium granulosum, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are rough to the touch, with a distinctive hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium granulosum is often found in temperate regions and can be invasive in some areas.
